item.title:
Googolplex is one of the largest numbers with a name.
Surpassed by many others later theorized, Carl Sagan once estimated that writing a googolplex would be physically impossible, since it would require more space than is available in the known universe
https://t.co/funHagkd3V https://t.co/uQWC76mK8G

item.title: DBS is invited to review the protocol to help the replication be as close & informative as possible. DBS could v easily help but strategically declines, so that when the study fails to replicate, DBS can point to various "flaws" in the design as the reason for the failure.
item.description: DBS is invited to review the protocol to help the replication be as close & informative as possible. DBS could v easily help but strategically declines, so that when the study fails to replicate, DBS can point to various "flaws" in the design as the reason for the failure.
item.content:encoded: DBS is invited to review the protocol to help the replication be as close & informative as possible. DBS could v easily help but strategically declines, so that when the study fails to replicate, DBS can point to various "flaws" in the design as the reason for the failure.

item.title:
DBS might then try to sneak in a face-saving post-hoc commentary to the journal, arguing why the replication was flawed & should be ignored.
Fortunately, science (in my field at least) is becoming better at preventing this tactic by DBS's. Perhaps politics will get there too.
